'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add openstack-ansible non-voting jobs to ARA check queue"

This reverts commit f7145751b386c5fb31e7159413f82dfcb094a3f0.

This doesn't work as we thought it would due to how OSA jobs are
designed to work. We'll re-implement a similar job that will work
properly.

Change-Id: I0780cb72a9bc44023c8cf07d2431590f11d60f4a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/38/436138/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replace github with git.openstack.org

The git.openstack.org has been the recommended git repo for OpenStack
projects.

Change-Id: Ia946b338d57bd3fba98f33fa4cf1c00dd05ff41f

commit_message:
Drop dictionary construction on get_plugin

No point in building a dictionary of weakrefs when
just retrieving one plugin.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I7f9e8494dec74f18ae6a57a8ffdf42570102dc3c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lib refs/changes/60/434560/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return weakref.proxy(self._plugins.get(alias))

commit_message:
[suse] Add SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY to Kuberneres cluster configuration

Change-Id: I18d6598e2f4b68ae7a672b794023e7408b7f8696
Partial-Bug: #1622949
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/63/411863/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Generate ServiceAccount key if needed SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY="/var/lib/kubernetes/serviceaccount.key" if [[ ! -f "${SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY}" ]]; then mkdir -p "$(dirname ${SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY})" openssl genrsa -out "${SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY}" 2048 2>/dev/null fi /^KUBE_API_ARGS=/ s|=.*|="--service-account-key-file='"$SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY"' --runtime-config=api\/all=true"| /^KUBE_CONTROLLER_MANAGER_ARGS=/ s|=.*|="--service_account_private_key_file='"$SERVICE_ACCOUNT_KEY"' --leader-elect=true --cluster-name=kubernetes --cluster-cidr='"$FLANNEL_NETWORK_CIDR"'"|

commit_message:
Adding an option to create internal network-type Flat.

This is needed because, since VMs with PF does not get VLAN tags and
as a result don't get access to DHCP. This patch adds a configuration
option to deal with this issue by configuring the port differently.

Closes-Bug: #1614092
Change-Id: Ib81b2f6f78334a941760e4998765e6aae6d978e9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/34/362834/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: choices=[None, 'normal', 'direct', 'macvtap', 'direct-physical'], cfg.StrOpt('provider_network_type', choices=[None, 'vlan', 'flat', 'vxlan', 'gre'], default=None, help="Create provider networks with a specific network_type. " "For SR-IOV, use flat."), cfg.StrOpt('provider_physical_network', default='physnet', help="Create provider networks with a specific network_type. ")

subject: Support neutron VxLAN with XenServer
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-20 07:04:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/b9bc2d4d673b10095335d5a42ddb9a4f91565786', 'message': 'Support neutron VxLAN with XenServer

This patch is to add the needed configurations to support VxLAN when
XenServer is hypervisor. The main part is to set the correct tunnel
IP for q-agt (run in compute node) and q-domua (run in network node)

Change-Id: I190adf9f91560e72c6b696fa15bce78cca785ddd
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2016-09-21 06:20:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/4e5adbfa36d2785b793d366157b5d2928dc064ad', 'message': "Support neutron VxLAN with XenServer

This patch is to add the needed configurations to support VxLAN when
XenServer is hypervisor.
1. Remove the restriction of using linux bridge in Dom0 as ovs-agent in
   compute node will apply security group rules in Dom0's linux bridge
2. Make udp port 4789 enabled in Dom0 as VxLAN use it by default
3. Configure tunnel bridge, tunnel types and tunnel endpoint IP for
   both q-agt(for comupte node) and q-domua(for network node),
   especially, endpoint IP of q-agt is configured as Dom0's IP

Change-Id: I190adf9f91560e72c6b696fa15bce78cca785ddd
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2016-09-21 09:09:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/3ab07479a14b928c623a798813d2f1d6ceaf80fa', 'message': "Support neutron VxLAN with XenServer

commit_message:
Support neutron VxLAN with XenServer

This patch is to add the needed configurations to support VxLAN when
XenServer is hypervisor.
1. Remove the restriction of using linux bridge in Dom0 as ovs-agent in
   compute node will apply security group rules in Dom0's linux bridge
2. Make udp port 4789 enabled in Dom0 as VxLAN use it by default
3. Configure tunnel bridge, tunnel types and tunnel endpoint IP for
   both q-agt(for network node) and q-domua(for compute node),
   especially, endpoint IP of q-domua is configured as Dom0's IP

Change-Id: I190adf9f91560e72c6b696fa15bce78cca785ddd

commit_message:
Create an automatic cookie update mechanism

Create a mechanism to automatically update the cookie value of flows.
Specifically for global cookie bits (local cookie bits are the
application's responsibility)

Change-Id: I8483eae33c6c019413241c58fbf435d02d893750
Related-Bug: #1471552

Add a interface to list floating IPs

This patch add a interface floatingip_list to find a list of
floating IP by specific filter.

commit_message:
Allow for retries after certain resource delete failures

In cases where a resource is "in use," a Conflict exception may be
thrown, in which case it is worth trying to delete again up to
action_retry_limit times before giving up. Also introduce the
exception PhysicalResourceExists for future use.

Change-Id: Ib9305ff55904638491c6d43599a639d3a658f54b
(cherry picked from commit 904bed006a207d173193009732f45ac55a15c2c9)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/03/404703/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class ResourceDeleteRetryTest(common.HeatTestCase): def setUp(self): super(ResourceDeleteRetryTest, self).setUp() self.env = environment.Environment() self.env.load({u'resource_registry': {u'OS::Test::GenericResource': u'GenericResourceType'}}) self.stack = parser.Stack(utils.dummy_context(), 'test_stack', template.Template(empty_template, env=self.env), stack_id=str(uuid.uuid4())) self.num_retries = 2 cfg.CONF.set_override('action_retry_limit', self.num_retries, enforce_type=True) def test_delete_retry_conflict(self): tmpl = rsrc_defn.ResourceDefinition('test_resource', 'GenericResourceType', {'Foo': 'xyz123'}) res = generic_rsrc.ResourceWithProps( 'test_resource', tmpl, self.stack) res.state_set(res.CREATE, res.COMPLETE, 'wobble') res.default_client_name = 'neutron' self.m.StubOutWithMock(timeutils, 'retry_backoff_delay') self.m.StubOutWithMock(generic_rsrc.GenericResource, 'handle_delete') # could be any exception that is_conflict(), using the neutron # client one generic_rsrc.GenericResource.handle_delete().AndRaise( neutron_exp.Conflict(message='foo', request_ids=[1])) for i in range(self.num_retries): timeutils.retry_backoff_delay(i+1, jitter_max=2.0).AndReturn( 0.01) generic_rsrc.GenericResource.handle_delete().AndRaise( neutron_exp.Conflict(message='foo', request_ids=[1])) self.m.ReplayAll() exc = self.assertRaises(exception.ResourceFailure, scheduler.TaskRunner(res.delete)) exc_text = six.text_type(exc) self.assertIn('Conflict', exc_text) self.m.VerifyAll() def test_delete_retry_phys_resource_exists(self): tmpl = rsrc_defn.ResourceDefinition( 'test_resource', 'Foo', {'Foo': 'abc'}) res = generic_rsrc.ResourceWithPropsRefPropOnDelete( 'test_resource', tmpl, self.stack) res.state_set(res.CREATE, res.COMPLETE, 'wobble') cfg.CONF.set_override('action_retry_limit', self.num_retries, enforce_type=True) self.m.StubOutWithMock(timeutils, 'retry_backoff_delay') self.m.StubOutWithMock(generic_rsrc.GenericResource, 'handle_delete') self.m.StubOutWithMock(generic_rsrc.ResourceWithPropsRefPropOnDelete, 'check_delete_complete') generic_rsrc.GenericResource.handle_delete().AndReturn(None) generic_rsrc.ResourceWithPropsRefPropOnDelete.check_delete_complete( None).AndRaise( exception.PhysicalResourceExists(name="foo")) for i in range(self.num_retries): timeutils.retry_backoff_delay(i+1, jitter_max=2.0).AndReturn( 0.01) generic_rsrc.GenericResource.handle_delete().AndReturn(None) if i < self.num_retries-1: generic_rsrc.ResourceWithPropsRefPropOnDelete.\ check_delete_complete(None).AndRaise( exception.PhysicalResourceExists(name="foo")) else: generic_rsrc.ResourceWithPropsRefPropOnDelete.\ check_delete_complete(None).AndReturn(True) self.m.ReplayAll() scheduler.TaskRunner(res.delete)() self.m.VerifyAll()

commit_message:
Make INSECURE_REGISTRY_URL works for CoreOS

Parent commit allow custom secure HYPERKUBE_IMAGE_REPO (which can also
be a local registry). Here we implement INSECURE_REGISTRY_URL which
allow settings custom insecure registry for Kubernetes infra components.

It also enable the insecure registry for Docker daemon.

Partially-Implements: blueprint coreos-best-pratice
Partially-Implements: blueprint support-insecure-registry
Change-Id: If00afa2e8a9100546301f9a1f161daed6e3ffc4f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/83/432383/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
TODO cleanup: osc-lib

osc-lib 1.3.0 is released, which contains these functions that still
need to be migrated all the way down to os-client-config.

Currently osc-lib 1.2.0 is in global-requirements so this can not be
merged yet, but is included here for testing and to be ready for when
g-r is unfrozen.

Change-Id: I7bc8ed6cf78f38bab4a718ed3e2a88641fa23f27

deleted_lines: # TODO(dtroyer): Remove _validate_auth_ksc when it is in osc-lib 1.3.0 def _validate_auth_ksc(self, config, cloud, fixed_argparse=None): """Old compatibility hack for OSC, no longer needed/wanted""" return config # TODO(dtroyer): Remove _validate_auth when it is in osc-lib 1.3.0 def _validate_auth(self, config, loader, fixed_argparse=None): """Validate auth plugin arguments""" # May throw a keystoneauth1.exceptions.NoMatchingPlugin plugin_options = loader.get_options() msgs = [] prompt_options = [] for p_opt in plugin_options: # if it's in config, win, move it and kill it from config dict # if it's in config.auth but not in config we're good # deprecated loses to current # provided beats default, deprecated or not winning_value = self._find_winning_auth_value(p_opt, config) if not winning_value: winning_value = self._find_winning_auth_value( p_opt, config['auth']) # if the plugin tells us that this value is required # then error if it's doesn't exist now if not winning_value and p_opt.required: msgs.append( 'Missing value {auth_key}' ' required for auth plugin {plugin}'.format( auth_key=p_opt.name, plugin=config.get('auth_type'), ) ) # Clean up after ourselves for opt in [p_opt.name] + [o.name for o in p_opt.deprecated]: opt = opt.replace('-', '_') config.pop(opt, None) config['auth'].pop(opt, None) if winning_value: # Prefer the plugin configuration dest value if the value's key # is marked as depreciated. if p_opt.dest is None: config['auth'][p_opt.name.replace('-', '_')] = ( winning_value) else: config['auth'][p_opt.dest] = winning_value # See if this needs a prompting if ( 'prompt' in vars(p_opt) and p_opt.prompt is not None and p_opt.dest not in config['auth'] and self._pw_callback is not None ): # Defer these until we know all required opts are present prompt_options.append(p_opt) if msgs: raise occ_exceptions.OpenStackConfigException('\n'.join(msgs)) else: for p_opt in prompt_options: config['auth'][p_opt.dest] = self._pw_callback(p_opt.prompt) return config

commit_message:
Use oslo.log library instead of system logging module

The constants of log levels were added in the 3.11 version of
the oslo.log library. So we can replace all usage of system
logging module with log module from oslo.log.
Use WritableLogger class from the loggers module of the oslo.log
library.

Change-Id: I73b7152d12765bb6641a757083368a0ab62d91d9

commit_message:
filesizeformat() does't consider the situation like `float('inf')`

    Sometimes the `bytes` may get float('inf'), then it will display "inf0PB" which will be a
    misleading for the user. Besides, with the hardware like storage and MEM getting larger
    and larger, we should consider size larger than PB like EB, ZB and YB.

Change-Id: I830ad440e9ef854006298bd946ab8ecf9d75757a
Closes-Bug: 1657174
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/52/421352/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if bytes == float('inf'): return _('Inifinity') if bytes < units.Ei: return _("%s PB") % filesize_number_format(bytes / units.Pi) if bytes < units.Zi: return _("%s EB") % filesize_number_format(bytes / units.Ei) if bytes < units.Yi: return _("%s ZB") % filesize_number_format(bytes / units.Zi) return _("%s YB") % filesize_number_format(bytes / units.Yi)

commit_message:
Tidy up the Profiler docs

This patch fixes the auto enumerated formatting for the profiler setup
steps, as well as cleaning up some of the text formatting and language.

Change-Id: I4a7f109e87a274ab85d67e6691a53a085c16f04f
Closes-bug: 1664500
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/76/433576/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: In the Ocata release of Horizon a new "OpenStack Profiler" panel was introduced. Once it is enabled and all prerequisites are set up, you can see which API calls Horizon actually makes when rendering a specific page. To re-render the page while profiling it, you'll need to use the "Profile" dropdown menu located in the top right corner of the screen. In order to be able to use "Profile" menu, the following steps need to be completed: #. Enable the Developer dashboard by copying ``_9001_developer.py`` from ``openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/enabled/`` to ``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/``. #. Copy ``openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_9030_profiler_settings.py.example`` to ``openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_9030_profiler_settings.py`` #. Copy ``openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/enabled/_9030_profiler.py`` to ``openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/_9030_profiler.py``. #. To support storing profiler data on server-side, MongoDB cluster needs to be installed on your Devstack host (default configuration), see `Installing MongoDB`_. Then, change the ``bindIp`` key in ``/etc/mongod.conf`` to ``0.0.0.0`` and invoke ``sudo service mongod restart``. #. Collect and compress static assets with ``tox -e manage -- collecstatic -c`` and ``tox -e manage -- compress`` #. Restart the web server. ready to profile your pages!
deleted_lines: In Ocata release of Horizon a new "OpenStack Profiler" panel is introduced within a Developer dashboard. Once it is enabled and all prerequisites are set up, you can see what API calls Horizon actually makes when rendering a specific page. To re-render the page while profiling it, you'll need to use "Profile" drop-down menu located left to the User menu in top right corner of the screen. In order to be able to use "Profile" menu the following steps need to be done: #. Ensure that the Developer dashboard is enabled (copy _9001_developer.py file from the openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/enabled folder into the openstack_dashboard/local/enabled folder if it is not already there). #. Copy openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_9030_profiler_settings.py.example file to openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.d/_9030_profiler_settings.py #. Copy openstack_dashboard/contrib/developer/enabled/_9030_profiler.py to openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/_9030_profiler.py . #. To support storing profiler data on server-side, MongoDB cluster needs to be installed on Devstack host (default configuration), see `Installing MongoDB`_. Then, change net:bindIp: key to 0.0.0.0 inside /etc/mongod.conf and invoke ``sudo service mongod restart`` for the changes to have an effect. #. Re-collect and re-compress static assets. #. Re-start the production web-server in case you are serving Horizon from it.ready to profile your pages!

commit_message:
Eagerly load resource_provider from foreignkey

This allows inventory/allocatoin to reference 'resource_provider'
field that were eagerly loaded from DB.

commit_message:
Support using panko as publisher than dispatcher

In Ceilometer, as we have deprecated collector service, we have added
alias to support configuring the old dispathcers such as gnocchi,
database, http as publishers, but for panko we can only use it by
configuring direct://?dispacher=panko in event_pipeline.yaml. This change
support the usage of configuring panko:// in event_pipeline.yaml

Change-Id: I54b1b1a9817a76b29cc439a1cebbba112fba2192
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/panko refs/changes/79/436279/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ceilometer.event.publisher = panko = panko.publisher:Publisher

commit_message:
Quote OS_PASSWORD variable

Unquoted OS_PASSWORD variable can break shell commands when special
characters are used.

Closes-Bug: #1663185
Change-Id: Ia61a4ea1861d0f8792355213443b202b15ab862c
(cherry picked from commit 02a104d77e546dd65353a99700c876162d0845ec)

added_lines: export OS_PASSWORD="{{ openrc_os_password }}"

commit_message:
Bring idempotency to swapon

swapon will fail ("swapon failed: Device or resource busy") if run twice
with the same file.

This ensures we test if the swap file is enabled (checking in /proc),
and if not, do the proper actions.

Change-Id: I5461efcd0352f831b2051b95661861bfdcd346af
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe.evrard@rackspace.co.uk>
(Manually cherry picked from commit 541f04e54683547182580ced58adfcdb2c920043)

commit_message:
[DOCS] Move links to role docs to deploy guide

The links to role docs are currently hidden at the bottom of the
developer guide. Move them directly to the deploy guide under the
'Configure the deployment' section.

Change-Id: I89da19ae319cbe10241b0e9a65bea5a8f1502e47

commit_message:
Introduce numa related objects

This patchset introduces the numa objects needed to represent the
CPUset related data in a standard NUMA object format.

This patch also introduces a driver method to query the host_cap
to figure out the cpuset information. Further improvments to this
patch may include detecting a linux operating system to decide
how the host_capability should be obtained.

This patch introduces a concept of floating_cpu_sets. The floating
cpusets are those, that are not meant for pinning. Such cpusets
are then excluded while doing the inventory of the host. These
cpusets are not the ones on which pinning is performed.

The floating cpuset is obtained by looking at a CONF parameter.
Further, the logic/format to specify the floating cpuset is kept
similar to the nova logic of obtaining the vcpu_pin_set and the
parsing logic has been more or less kept similar to nova/virt/
hardware.py get_vcpu_pin_set() method.

Change-Id: Iae0336a0996af1fa899d6ecae34d1bc3d881829e

commit_message:
devstack: enable placement-client for subnode

For subnode, placement-client is needed. not placement-api.
So enable placement-client for subnode, not placement-api.

Change-Id: I58630bf5ea4eed3de115eb0ffc0bba2fbc5c0010

User Survey has closed. This is updated data from Feb 21,
for production use.
* Isolate deployments in "Production or Full Operational Use" (253)

commit_message:
Update Production Use data from Feb 21 Survey data

User Survey has closed. This is updated data from Feb 21,
for production use.
* Isolate deployments in "Production or Full Operational Use" (253)
* Look for project usage either in "Production" or "Testing"
* Count the project use, and calculate an overall percentage by dividing by the number of deployments

Barbican (Key Management)	22	8.70%
Ceilometer (Metering & Monitoring)	139	54.94%
Cinder (Block Storage)	223	88.14%
Congress (Governance Service)	5	1.98%
Cue (Message Broker Service)	4	1.58%

TripleO (Deployment)	23	9.09%

Zaqar (Message Service)	10	3.95%

commit_message:
Remove deprecated argument --profile

Both command 'openstack' and it's subcommand 'cluster create'
have a argument named '--profile'. In openstackclient, argument
'--profile' is deprecated and suggest insted of '--os-profile',
this commit(Change-Id: I2e623411a56096b4cc352f4eedbf770632ae2cc3)
Renamed '--profile' to '--os-profile'. Because of the conflict, we
should remove this deprecated argument, if not, the subcommand will
be error.

Change-Id: Ib7725bb1e80c30021667b099eef6158206f78d89
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/osc-lib refs/changes/03/423603/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # NOTE(dtroyer): Remove this 'if' block when the --profile global # option is removed if osprofiler_profiler and self.options.old_profile: self.log.warning( 'The --profile option is deprecated, ' 'please use --os-profile instead' ) if not self.options.profile: self.options.profile = self.options.old_profile # NOTE(dtroyer): This global option should have been named # --os-profile as --profile interferes with at # least one existing command option. Deprecate # --profile and remove after Apr 2017. parser.add_argument( '--profile', metavar='hmac-key', dest='old_profile', help=argparse.SUPPRESS, )

Omit rpc call when l2_pop is configured

otherwise, the variable details is not being used.

commit_message:
Update docs-install-guide for Ocata

Adds the results of the ops:docs-install-guide for Ocata RC

Data is from:
* Draft Install index: http://docs.openstack.org/project-install-guide/draft/
* Wiki pages
* Project developer pages
* Google search for "OpenStack {project} install"

Assumption has been made that the guides that exist work without major bugs.

Change-Id: I7545a0f5a66372d73249850f564cbd53eb7b345b

commit_message:
Fix override resolv.conf format

Was: echo "8.8.8.8" > /etc/resolv.conf
Became: echo "nameserver 8.8.8.8" > /etc/resolv.conf

Change-Id: I96a0f9f681f196721f49d577f919cd49c3218ac9
Closes-Bug: #1654200
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/20/419120/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: cmd = "echo 'nameserver {}' > /etc/resolv.conf".format(settings.DNS)

commit_message:
Upload repos before install Fuel from packages

This test which deploys Fuel master node on vanilla
CentOS (base CentOS cloud image) first installs
fuel-release package which configures default rpm repos.
But we need to modify default repos before starting
deployment.

Change-Id: Ib0e1c3d4c1d766ae440e2967b8dab6cf23fb269f
Partial-Bug: #1654200
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-qa refs/changes/26/419626/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from fuelweb_test.helpers.utils import generate_yum_repos_config if settings.RPM_REPOS_YAML: with ssh.open_on_remote( ip=ssh.admin_ip, path='/etc/yum.repos.d/custom.repo', mode="w") as f: f.write(generate_yum_repos_config(settings.RPM_REPOS_YAML)) if settings.DEB_REPOS_YAML: ssh = SSHManager() pack_path = "/root/default_deb_repos.yaml" ssh.upload_to_remote( ip=ssh.admin_ip, source=settings.DEB_REPOS_YAML, target=pack_path)

commit_message:
Remove support for py34

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka. This is due to
the change from Ubuntu Trusty to Xenial, where only python3.5 is
available. There is no need to continue to keep these settings.

Change-Id: Ia2f10bc4875e19b4b819e13697bab632ee10bf1d

commit_message:
tests: Remove duplicate NumaHostInfo

The aforementioned class was duplicated in no less than three files.
Remove this duplication by centralizing the class. This allows for the
removal of the 'get_numa_topology' method of HostInfo, which existed
purely to allow easy overriding of this property.

Change-Id: Icacda8484c9ede1a0ddf0831bc457b83b1dd6931
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/62/402562/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: host_info = fakelibvirt.NUMAHostInfo(cpu_nodes=2, cpu_sockets=1, cpu_cores=2, cpu_threads=2, kB_mem=15740000) host_info = fakelibvirt.NUMAHostInfo(cpu_nodes=1, cpu_sockets=1, cpu_cores=5, cpu_threads=2, kB_mem=15740000) host_info = fakelibvirt.NUMAHostInfo(cpu_nodes=1, cpu_sockets=1, cpu_cores=2, kB_mem=15740000)
deleted_lines: class NumaHostInfo(fakelibvirt.HostInfo): def __init__(self, **kwargs): super(NumaHostInfo, self).__init__(**kwargs) self.numa_mempages_list = [] def get_numa_topology(self): if self.numa_topology: return self.numa_topology topology = fakelibvirt.NUMATopology(self.cpu_nodes, self.cpu_sockets, self.cpu_cores, self.cpu_threads, self.kB_mem) self.numa_topology = topology # update number of active cpus cpu_count = len(topology.cells) * len(topology.cells[0].cpus) self.cpus = cpu_count - len(self.disabled_cpus_list) return topology def set_custom_numa_toplogy(self, topology): self.numa_topology = topology host_info = NumaHostInfo(cpu_nodes=2, cpu_sockets=1, cpu_cores=2, cpu_threads=2, kB_mem=15740000) host_info = NumaHostInfo(cpu_nodes=1, cpu_sockets=1, cpu_cores=5, cpu_threads=2, kB_mem=15740000) host_info = NumaHostInfo(cpu_nodes=1, cpu_sockets=1, cpu_cores=2, kB_mem=15740000)

commit_message:
Move Docker registry setup into its own profile

The new tripleo::profile::base::docker_registry profile sets up
a v2 registry instead of the old, deprecated v1 registry.

Change-Id: I89e14cc2a27299ce4c191d2a823deb0424693831
Depends-On: I1227956a0389497eedc00e4ec817f52be608dc75

commit_message:
Do not init data on subscribe for unresponsive service

The initializing to empty causes agnostic to delete policy facts
when the service is a regular policy. This change forgoes the
initialization. Does not affect evaluation because when there is no
data, evaluation defaults to False/empty.

Change-Id: I879b73eab8a6a083a9fb47bef09abe5ee398f949

commit_message:
Simplified two-phase commit for policy rules

Change-Id: I3b8ffbcb6adb00170695ee0b106f6d6d633de968
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/congress-specs refs/changes/52/408352/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================================================== Simplified Two-phase commit for policy rule creation ========================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/congress/+spec/example In active-active replication of policy engines, two instances may accept policy rule creation requests that conflict by creating unsupported recursion. This spec proposes a mechanism by which new rules are created in a staging phase and then commit to the rule system only if all the actual and staging rules form an acceptable collection. Problem description =================== Current congress policy engine does not support a recursive rule set. On a rule creation, a policy engine checks for recursion before accepting the rule, but when conflicting rules come to two difference policy engine instances, the the rules may be accepted incorrectly. Example: * PE1 gets rule: p(x) :- q(x) * PE2 gets rule: q(x) :- p(x) If the two rules arrive at approximately the same time, they may both be accepted, leading to an unsupported recursive rule set. Proposed change =============== Implement the following new behavior. When a new rule arrives at a policy engine: * add to database as a tentative rule. * Check the union of all the accepted and tentative rules for recursion. - If the union has recursion, reject the new rule and remove it as a tentative rule. - If the union does not have recursion, accept the new rule. New database backend tables: * tentative_rules table to hold the tentative rules. * direct_dependency table to represent a direct dependency between policy tables. Example schema: policytabledirectdep(row_id, rule_id, depender, dependee). All direct dependencies based on accepted and tentative rules are represented. New direct dependencies are added at the same time tentative rules are added. * dedendency view on the direct dependency table to represent general dependency between policy tables. - Example definition (to be converted to SQL): + policytabledependency(x,y) :- policytabledirectdep(x,y) + policytabledependency(x,z) :- policytabledependency(x,y), policytabledirectdep(y,z) - Ruleset is recursive if and only if there is a policytabledependency(x,x) Alternatives ------------ We could have each policy engine could lock the database prior to processing a rule add request. The drawback is that with such an implementation we cannot support common HA database solutions such as Galera, because explicit locks are often not supported. Policy ------ Not applicable. Policy actions -------------- Not applicable. Data sources ------------ Not applicable. Data model impact ----------------- (Repeating a part of the proposed changes section) New database backend tables: * tentative_rules table to hold the tentative rules. * direct_dependency table to represent a direct dependency between policy tables. Example schema: policytabledirectdep(row_id, rule_id, depender, dependee). All direct dependencies based on accepted and tentative rules are represented. New direct dependencies are added at the same time tentative rules are added. * dedendency view on the direct dependency table to represent general dependency between policy tables. - Example definition (to be converted to SQL): + policytabledependency(x,y) :- policytabledirectdep(x,y) + policytabledependency(x,z) :- policytabledependency(x,y), policytabledirectdep(y,z) - Ruleset is recursive if and only if there is a policytabledependency(x,x) REST API impact --------------- A rejection of rule due to recursion is not necessarily final. If other conflicting tentative rules are also rejected, resubmission of the same rule may be accepted. Security impact --------------- No security impact. Notifications impact -------------------- No impact. Other end user impact --------------------- Same as described in REST API impact. Performance impact ------------------ TODO Other deployer impact --------------------- TODO Developer impact ---------------- TODO Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: ekcs Work items ---------- TODO Dependencies ============ TODO database backend versions Testing ======= TODO Documentation impact ==================== No additional impact References ========== TODO

commit_message:
Remove mox from unit/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py (5)

Replace mox with mock in following methods of RbdTestCase:
- test_cache
- test_cache_base_dir_exists
- test_cache_image_exists
- test_create_image_resize
- test_create_image
- test_create_image_already_exists

Partially implements: blueprint remove-mox-ocata
Change-Id: Id4d02a0cb76756c44c98faabe530791c79bddda9

commit_message:
Adding bootstrap to docker container

This commit removes the key generation stage of building Anchor
containers. When a container is started it will look for a key in a
docker volume named '/key' if there is a correctly formatted key it will
attempt to use it. If not it will generate one before starting normal
operations.

Change-Id: I569f0fe07171faeed0cffc7c87f3075a094ec811
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/anchor refs/changes/75/315675/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import os import shutil from subprocess import call # When running inside a container, it's important that the deployer has a way # to provide key material and configuration data # This script looks for two mounted volumes '/key' and '/config'. They can # contain key material and configuration files respectively. If data is found # in either of these volumes it will be used to over-write the defaults within # the Anchor container. # In the case that '/key' is empty. This script will generate a new private key # and copy that over the one to be used by Anchor. # In the case that '/config' is empty no action will be taken # It's worth noting that the default location for key material can be modified # in the config.json. That's really up to the deployer. # The reason we have a separate /key volume is to trigger a new key to be # created even if we want to use a default configuration. newkey_newcert = ["openssl", "req", "-out", "/key/root-ca.crt", "-keyout", "/key/root-ca-unwrapped.key", "-newkey", "rsa:4096", "-subj", "/CN=Anchor Test CA", "-nodes", "-x509", "-days", "365"] newcert_existkey = ["openssl", "req", "-new" "-out", "/key/root-ca.crt", "-key", "/key/root-ca-unwrapped.key", "-subj", "'/CN=Anchor Test CA'", "-nodes", "-x509", "-days", "365"] #/key #TODO: Exception handling if os.path.isdir('/key'): if not os.path.exists('/key/root-ca-unwrapped.key'): #If the user for some reason has given us a certificate but no key, that #wont work, we'll create a new key and overwrite the certificate print "[container_bootstrap.py] Generating new key and new certificate" call(newkey_newcert) if os.path.exists('/key/root-ca-unwrapped.key'): if not os.path.exists('/key/root-ca.crt'): print "[container_bootstrap.py] Generating new certificate" call(newcert_existkey) #COPY KEY TO DEFAULT LOCATION WITHIN container shutil.copy2('/key/root-ca-unwrapped.key', 'CA/') shutil.copy2('/key/root-ca.crt', 'CA/') os.chmod('/key/root-ca-unwrapped.key', 0600) #/config if os.path.exists('/config/config.json'): shutil.copy2('/config/config.json','./') call(['pecan','serve','config.py'])

commit_message:
Suspended audit state

Change-Id: I3813df0017457410ceb1bf6ac508fdb9a2fc5d1e
Implements: blueprint suspended-audit-state
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/watcher-specs refs/changes/44/434144/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ========================================== Suspended audit state ========================================== Include the URL of your launchpad blueprint: https://blueprints.launchpad.net/watcher/+spec/suspended-audit-state Problem description =================== If an audit with continuous mode needs to be stopped creating action plan temporarily and started creating again, the audit have to be deleted and recreated. Use Cases ---------- * As an administrator, I want to suspend an audit with continuous mode to create action plan for maintenance. * As an administrator, I want to resume the audit with continuous mode to create action plan after maintenance. Proposed change =============== New audit state **SUSPENDED** is introduced. If **ONGOING** audit is changed to **SUSPENDED** state, the audit stops creating action plan. If **SUSPENDED** audit is changed to **ONGOING** state, the audit starts creating action plan again. Alternatives ------------ * Delete the audit and create again. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: <nakamura-h> Work Items ---------- * Add **SUSPENDED** in State class of watcher.objects.audit module. * Update ContinuousAuditHandler that SUSPENDED is also inactive state. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests should be updated. Documentation Impact ==================== Need to update the **Audit State Machine** in the architecture documentation. References ========== None History ======= None

commit_message:
Start adding projects / jobs to zuulv3 configuration

Create a top level job an project for openstack-infra/zuul. We'll be
running the pep8 job, with the pep8 playbook.

Change-Id: I1b43d7609e67d9b3102f430c0b72a1ed3ee842bf
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Remove per-device reconstruction stats

Now that we're shuffling parts before going through them, those stats no
longer make sense -- device completion would always be 100%.

Also, always use delete_partition for cleanup, so we have one place to
make improvements. This means we'll properly clean up non-numeric
directories.

Also also, put more I/O in the tpool in delete_partition.

Change-Id: Ie06bb16c130d46ccf887c8fcb252b8d018072d68
Related-Change: I69e4c4baee64fd2192cbf5836b0803db1cc71705

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: Return dict in delete_cgsnapshot

Dell EMC SC driver is currently returning a modified snapshot
object rather than a dict. This returns a dict as it should.

Change-Id: Ic6b88d6e1d1fe960db9762bda8ba266327944c3c
Closes-Bug: #1664694
(cherry picked from commit c5fb00a076884171afd41cbc97f486952873892c)

commit_message:
Add devref for kubernetes translate 1 and 2

This document describes how to plug Docker/Neutron into Kubernetes
following the so-called "translate" approach --- translating k8s/CNI
networking to Docker/Neutron networking.

The design is factored into two levels of ambition.  Level 1 does not
include multi-tenancy.  Level 2 adds multi-tenancy.

WIP

Change-Id: If99eaad9fdae6e89edb81a2e1aa7a1f3ba98995b
Implements: blueprint kuryr-k8s-integration

commit_message:
Deals with cases where mtu is defaulted to zero

If the network has a mtu assigned to it but the assigned value
is zero (as is the case by default in pre Mitaka releases), we
need to set the mtu to our default value or setting it to zero
will throw exception in pyroute2 library.

Change-Id: I463a363b7a7a8ea35acdfb668b4dc32c4dc8b017
Closes-Bug: 1635009

commit_message:
Moving docs from Kuryr to Kuryr-Kubernetes

This is one part of the process of organizing the Kuryr docs
across Kuryr, Kuryr-Libnetwork, and Kuryr-Kubernetes. This
commit in particular moves some Kuryr-Kubernetes documentation
from Kuryr devref to the Kuryr-Kubernetes devref.

Change-Id: I030e5afd92049119068fbac6af515ca3ff962385
Depends-On: If0e23ffe10f798d2f9f5b37e1b996bd069715721

commit_message:
Add trailing commas to follow the coding standard

This patch adds the missing trailing commas required in the coding
standard of OpenStack.

If a line exceeded 79 characters, I added # noqa. I also broke lines if
the list or the dictionary has more than one elements.

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#dictionaries-lists

Change-Id: I6616efd6699af63f5e53fd7df1d124d6af851f3d
Signed-off-by: Taku Fukushima <f.tac.mac@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1523507

commit_message:
As the code does in ipam_request_address, in ipam_release_address we also
pick first prefix if pool has more than one prefixes.

Change-Id: Ic11bb8c6f2ef340107b5a31bab16eaa696805dda

commit_message:
Fix the installation guide

The installation guide has been outdated and the steps
don't seem to work. This commit fixed it.

Change-Id: I5b6b60d24276a9bb66a7300ebf23273c0ffd3be8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuxi refs/changes/96/399296/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: $ sudo apt-get install python-dev $ python setup.py install

'}, {'number': 6, 'created': '2016-10-17 12:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/unit/test_test.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/9d636ba82401548b37b0bbdd7ad302db592b4361', 'message': 'Tests: improve assertJsonEqual diagnostic message

This change adds a path information in assertJsonEqual output.
Example:
before: Difference: 1 != 2
arter: Difference: 1 != 2: path: root.country.state.city[0].street.building

Change-Id: I4243e48cc7f01b5fa049e0c4aef48a72cc640d0a

commit_message:
Tests: improve assertJsonEqual diagnostic message

This change adds a path information in assertJsonEqual output.
Example:
before: Difference: 1 != 2
arter: Difference: 1 != 2: path: root.country.state.city[0].street.building

Change-Id: I4243e48cc7f01b5fa049e0c4aef48a72cc640d0a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/44/372644/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: self.assertIn("3 != 4", e.mismatch.describe()) self.assertIn("'b' != 'c'", e.mismatch.describe()) def _describe_mismatch(self, expected, observed): try: self.assertJsonEqual(expected, observed) except Exception as e: return e.mismatch.describe() else: self.fail("This should have raised a mismatch exception") def test_provide_diagnostic_output(self): self.assertEqual('[] != {}: path: root', self._describe_mismatch([], {})) self.assertEqual('1 != 2: path: root.val', self._describe_mismatch({"val": 1}, {"val": 2})) self.assertEqual('1 != 2: path: root[0]', self._describe_mismatch([1], [2])) expected = { 'country': { 'state': { 'city': [{'street': {'building': 1}}] } } } observed = { 'country': { 'state': { 'city': [{'street': {'building': 2}}] } } } self.assertEqual( '1 != 2: path: root.country.state.city[0].street.building', self._describe_mismatch(expected, observed))

I2329aa122b9cacb3c7de18a21353f53ea1d988ed removed the core_list option

Change-Id: If35b11cc416067b7507e5fece18a969fe90be6b1

commit_message:
Fix ml2 ovs tests

I2329aa122b9cacb3c7de18a21353f53ea1d988ed removed the core_list option
from vswitch, so we need to update the tests to use the correct
parameter.

Change-Id: If35b11cc416067b7507e5fece18a969fe90be6b1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-neutron refs/changes/28/436128/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: "class { 'vswitch::dpdk': host_core_list => '1,2', memory_channels => '1' }"

This patch adds the QoS panel and displaying qos policy.
Delete actions are added for row and batch.
Other actions will be added in subsequent patches.

To Test:
Neutron QoS plugin should be enabled in your setup.
To enable the QoS in devstack please add below two lines
in the local.conf

    enable_plugin neutron git://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron
    enable_service q-qos

and rebuild your stack (./stack.sh).
create some qos policies via CLI(neutron qos-policy-create policy1).
now you can list and delete the policies using this patch.

Change-Id: I88b7ed48abfb8c258dfc2c31d369754184ad60c1
Partially-implements: blueprint network-bandwidth-limiting-qos

    enable_plugin neutron git://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron
    enable_service q-qos

and rebuild your stack (./stack.sh).
create some qos policies via CLI (neutron qos-policy-create policy1).
now you can list and delete the policies using this patch.

commit_message:
Adding angular QoS panel in Horizon

This patch adds the QoS panel which displayes QoS policies.
Delete actions are added for row and batch.
Other actions will be added in subsequent patches.

To Test:
Neutron's QoS plugin must be enabled in your setup.
To enable the QoS plugin in devstack please add the following lines
in the local.conf

    enable_plugin neutron git://git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron
    enable_service q-qos

and rebuild your stack (./stack.sh).
create some qos policies via CLI (neutron qos-policy-create policy1).
now you can list and delete the policies using this patch.

Change-Id: I88b7ed48abfb8c258dfc2c31d369754184ad60c1
Partially-implements: blueprint network-bandwidth-limiting-qos
Co-Authored-By: Beth Elwell <e.r.elwell@gmail.com>

commit_message:
avoid unnecessary neutron api call in revoke_expose_ports

kuryr will always call neutron.show_port and neutron.update_port in
revoke_expose_ports. This patch avoid unnecessary neutron api call,
when the security group is not changed.

Change-Id: I8fc0c85483eefb98b0f5f5214762de0703fd76c1
Closes-bug: #1662039

subject: Cinder use correct glance API when RBD enabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-17 22:14:43.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/group_vars/all.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/commit/5c33ad14dc7ea710ef151eb5bbc2eb54a4197f3f', 'message': 'Cinder use correct glance API when RBD enabled

The syntax of the jinja block was broken and outputted a line break
always, like this:
ok: [lsn-d6329_cinder_volumes_container-9a2bbc7d] => {
    "msg": "True\n"
}

So the resulting evaluation was always false, and glance API v1 was
used by cinder-volume, breaking the ceph CoW functionality.

This fixes the variable to eval properly as a boolean and make
Cinder use the correct glance API version.

Change-Id: I9c1f31bba80bf2591710fd4d59f320ffadaf1c8b
(cherry picked from commit 6bc3bf911cff85afd08e37c19faeafaaca8e1494)
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder use correct glance API when RBD enabled

The syntax of the jinja block was broken and outputted a line break
always, like this:
ok: [lsn-d6329_cinder_volumes_container-9a2bbc7d] => {
    "msg": "True\n"
}

So the resulting evaluation was always false, and glance API v1 was
used by cinder-volume, breaking the ceph CoW functionality.

This fixes the variable to eval properly as a boolean and make
Cinder use the correct glance API version.

Change-Id: I9c1f31bba80bf2591710fd4d59f320ffadaf1c8b
(cherry picked from commit 6bc3bf911cff85afd08e37c19faeafaaca8e1494)

commit_message:
Add zuulv3 main.yaml

This adds a simple starter zuulv3 main.yaml file for testing the POC
zuul deployment. Note that puppet-zuul copies the entirety of
project-config/zuul into /etc/zuul/layout on the hosts it deploys
zuul to. So this will give us /etc/zuul/layout/main.yaml which we
probably want to change to /etc/zuul/main.yaml in the future.

Change-Id: I028d3da2248ea6a28201d9afe86240b61d6cc772

commit_message:
Fix problem with ARA execution for tox envs not named 'functional'

The ARA prep currently hard codes the tox environment name to
find pip/python in the tox env called 'functional', which does
not universally work.

This patch removes the strict path for pip/python as the script
only runs once the python venv has been activated and therefore
the correct binary path is used.

Change-Id: Ibd8957a85092a48089a6d9d336f27ccab36f009c

commit_message:
Adds more values into variables.sh and places in extra scripts

More values have been added to the variables.sh file. None of these have
been adjusted from the default values but this now provides a standard
goto place to have all these values and be able to change with ease.

An include for varibles.sh is now also at the top of each of the script
files.

Change-Id: I2354c87e985115ce0b7f168ab1d056d5032e5cff
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/92/436092/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # What branch of Openstack-Ansible are we deploying from OSA_BRANCH=master # What is the default disk device name DEVICE_NAME=vda # What default network device should we use for Cobbler DEFAULT_NETWORK=eth0 # What is the default virtual machine disk size in GB VM_DISK_SIZE=252 # Do we want to do all the required host setup SETUP_HOST=true # Do we want to do disk partitioning or is there a partition ready to use PARTITION_HOST=true # Do we want to set up networking on the host for Virsh SETUP_VIRSH_NET=true # When the virtual machines are re-kicked do we format them VM_IMAGE_CREATE=true # Should we run the deploy Openstack-Ansible script at the end of the build script DEPLOY_OSA=true # Should we pre-configure the environment before we deploy OpenStack-Ansible PRE_CONFIG_OSA=true # Should we run the final deploy of OpenStack-Ansible RUN_OSA=true

commit_message:
Adds in option to disable overriding of apt-sources list

By default AIO deploy overrides apt-sources, if things like a local
mirror are already set up then this script will override these. This
option allows for the override to be disabled.

Change-Id: Id84c2c5d12153125d7ac6698493c41a840993c5b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-ops refs/changes/72/436072/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # By default AIO deploy overrides apt-sources, if things like a local mirror are already # set up then this script will override these. This option allows for the override to be # disabled. OVERRIDE_SOURCES=true

commit_message:
Use public and unified method get_console_url()

Novaclient has provided a public and unified method
get_console_url() to get console urls of server.
This change switches to use it.

Change-Id: Ie6b9d8cfc57a6943b5d64a4064e4bdd372cd8cd3
Depends-on: I36c6209b17ef453e1c2e47841daf41f81af471dc
Closes-Bug: #1654913

deleted_lines: data = None if parsed_args.url_type in ['novnc', 'xvpvnc']: data = server.get_vnc_console(parsed_args.url_type) if parsed_args.url_type in ['spice-html5']: data = server.get_spice_console(parsed_args.url_type) if parsed_args.url_type in ['rdp-html5']: data = server.get_rdp_console(parsed_args.url_type) if parsed_args.url_type in ['serial']: data = server.get_serial_console(parsed_args.url_type) if parsed_args.url_type in ['webmks']: data = server.get_mks_console()

Symmetric Chain Support Tempest Api Test

   Add tempest_plugin api test cases for symmetric

Implements: blueprint symmetric-port-chain-ovs-agent

Co-Authored-By: Louis Fourie <louis.fourie@huawei.com>
Change-Id: Ic002c3cf7814445d0fb3830d9abbe233ed669d89

added_lines: @decorators.idempotent_id('1b84cf01-9c09-4ce7-bc72-b15e39076669') def test_create_port_chain_flowclassifiers_symmetric(self): # Create symmetric port chain router = self.admin_routers_client.create_router( name=data_utils.rand_name('router-'))['router'] self.addCleanup( self.admin_routers_client.delete_router, router['id']) port_kwargs = {"binding:host_id": self.host_id} dst_port = self._create_port( network=self.network, **port_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._try_delete_port, dst_port['id']) self.admin_routers_client.add_router_interface( router['id'], port_id=dst_port['id']) self.addCleanup(self.admin_routers_client.remove_router_interface, router['id'], port_id=dst_port['id']) pp = self._try_create_port_pair() pg = self._try_create_port_pair_group(port_pairs=[pp['id']]) fc = self._try_create_flowclassifier( logical_destination_port=dst_port['id']) pc = self._try_create_port_chain( port_pair_groups=[pg['id']], flow_classifiers=[fc['id']], chain_parameters={'symmetric': True}) pcs = self.portchain_client.list_port_chains() self.assertIn(( pc['id'], pc['name'], pc['chain_parameters'], set(pc['flow_classifiers']) ), [( m['id'], m['name'], m['chain_parameters'], set(m['flow_classifiers']) ) for m in pcs['port_chains']]) @decorators.idempotent_id('1b84cf01-9c09-4ce7-bc72-b15e39076490') def test_create_port_chain_port_pair_group_symmetric(self): # Create symmetric port chain with port_pair_group router = self.admin_routers_client.create_router( name=data_utils.rand_name('router-'))['router'] self.addCleanup( self.admin_routers_client.delete_router, router['id']) port_kwargs = {"binding:host_id": self.host_id} dst_port = self._create_port( network=self.network, **port_kwargs) self.addCleanup(self._try_delete_port, dst_port['id']) self.admin_routers_client.add_router_interface( router['id'], port_id=dst_port['id']) self.addCleanup(self.admin_routers_client.remove_router_interface, router['id'], port_id=dst_port['id']) pp = self._try_create_port_pair() pg = self._try_create_port_pair_group(port_pairs=[pp['id']]) fc = self._try_create_flowclassifier( logical_destination_port=dst_port['id']) pc = self._try_create_port_chain( port_pair_groups=[pg['id']], flow_classifiers=[fc['id']], chain_parameters={'symmetric': True}) pcs = self.portchain_client.list_port_chains() self.assertIn(( pc['id'], pc['name'], pc['port_pair_groups'], pc['chain_parameters'] ), [( m['id'], m['name'], m['port_pair_groups'], m['chain_parameters'] ) for m in pcs['port_chains']])

commit_message:
Include SRC/DST IP in the flowclassifier from logical ports

See Bug #1665960.
If not src/dst prefix is specified, then get the src/dst IP from
the logical-src/dst port and insert this prefix in the flowclassifier.

Change-Id:  I148e52b86ad0107ca63c92fcc800e9eb69f7a65a
Co-Authored-By: Cathy Zhang  <cathy.h.zhang@huawei.com>
Partial-Bug: Bug #1665960 - Addresses unintended behavior but only
if the port has a single IP address.
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-sfc refs/changes/81/435281/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: port_src = self._get_port(context, logical_source_port) if source_ip_prefix is None: src_ipaddresses = port_src['fixed_ips'] if len(src_ipaddresses) == 1: source_ip_prefix = src_ipaddresses[0]['ip_address'] if logical_destination_port is not None: port_dst = self._get_port(context, logical_destination_port) if destination_ip_prefix is None: dst_ipaddresses = port_dst['fixed_ips'] if len(dst_ipaddresses) == 1: destination_ip_prefix = dst_ipaddresses[0]['ip_address']
deleted_lines: self._get_port(context, logical_source_port) if logical_destination_port is not None: self._get_port(context, logical_destination_port)

subject: Compute API Floating Ips Bulk Tests.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-15 17:46:25.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/compute/test_floating_ips_bulk_rbac.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/patrole/commit/c3f1c615dc49beb2c63cb4853521bbed55924c52', 'message': 'Compute API Floating Ips Bulk Tests.

Adds tests for compute floating ips bulk API.

Since this API is deprecated for microversions
beginning at 2.36, the microversion for this test is explicitly
set to 2.35, as 2.36 onward will throw a 404, resulting in
confusion, because the Patrole framework will interpret this
as a policy permissions error, not necessarily a microversioning
issue [1].

This patch also breaks with previous Patrole convention by
altering the way the skip_checks classmethod is written, to
align with the way Tempest compute skip_checks are currently
written; as an example see [2].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=list-floating-ip-addresses-detail
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/compute/admin/test_flavors_access.py

Change-Id: I10b14a7e381d9e9961dbce761f0114a1f21eda87
'}]
commit_message:
Compute API Floating Ips Bulk Tests.

Adds tests for compute floating ips bulk API.

Since this API is deprecated for microversions
beginning at 2.36, the microversion for this test is explicitly
set to 2.35, as 2.36 onward will throw a 404, resulting in
confusion, because the Patrole framework will interpret this
as a policy permissions error, not necessarily a microversioning
issue [1].

This patch also breaks with previous Patrole convention by
altering the way the skip_checks classmethod is written, to
align with the way Tempest compute skip_checks are currently
written; as an example see [2].

[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=list-floating-ip-addresses-detail
[2] https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/api/compute/admin/test_flavors_access.py

Change-Id: I10b14a7e381d9e9961dbce761f0114a1f21eda87
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/23/434423/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 AT&T Corporation. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from tempest import test from patrole_tempest_plugin import rbac_rule_validation from patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_utils import rbac_utils from patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.api.compute import rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class FloatingIpsBulkRbacTest(rbac_base.BaseV2ComputeRbacTest): # Tests will fail with a 404 starting from microversion 2.36, according to: # https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/ # compute/?expanded=list-floating-ips-detail max_microversion = '2.35' @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(FloatingIpsBulkRbacTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.client = cls.os.floating_ips_bulk_client @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(FloatingIpsBulkRbacTest, cls).skip_checks() if not test.is_extension_enabled('os-floating-ips-bulk', 'compute'): msg = "%s skipped as os-floating-ips-bulk extension not enabled." \ % cls.__name__ raise cls.skipException(msg) def tearDown(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=False) super(FloatingIpsBulkRbacTest, self).tearDown() @decorators.idempotent_id('3b5c8a02-005d-4256-8a95-6fa2f389c6cf') @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-floating-ips-bulk") def test_list_floating_ips_bulk(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.client.list_floating_ips_bulk()['floating_ip_info']

commit_message:
Use dynamic includes to save time

This patch adds a dynamic include for installing packages
via yum or apt. It avoids having so many skipped tasks and
should save some time during gate runs.

Change-Id: I953764b7bb95df0625993a31ba4effc8b81499aa
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_client refs/changes/29/436129/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Compute API Aggregates Tests

Adds tests for compute aggregates API
Partially-Implements: blueprint initial-tests-compute
Co-Authored-By: Felipe Monteiro <felipe.monteiro@att.com>

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest.lib.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.lib.common.utils import test_utils from tempest import config from tempest.lib import decorators from patrole_tempest_plugin import rbac_rule_validation from patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_utils import rbac_utils from patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.api.compute import rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class AggregatesRbacTest(rbac_base.BaseV2ComputeRbacTest): def tearDown(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) super(AggregatesRbacTest, self).tearDown() @classmethod def skip_checks(cls): super(AggregatesRbacTest, cls).skip_checks() if not CONF.compute_feature_enabled.api_extensions: raise cls.skipException( '%s skipped as no compute extensions enabled' % cls.__name__) @classmethod def setup_clients(cls): super(AggregatesRbacTest, cls).setup_clients() cls.hosts_client = cls.os.hosts_client @classmethod def resource_setup(cls): super(AggregatesRbacTest, cls).resource_setup() cls.aggregates = [] @classmethod def clear_aggregates(cls): for aggregate_id in cls.aggregates: test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc( self.aggregates_client.delete_aggregate, aggregate_id) def _create_aggregate(self): agg_name = data_utils.rand_name('aggregate') aggregate = self.aggregates_client.create_aggregate(name=agg_name) aggregate_id = aggregate['aggregate']['id'] self.aggregates.append(aggregate_id) return aggregate_id def _add_host_to_aggregate(self, aggregate_id): host_name = self.hosts_client.list_hosts()['hosts'][0]['host_name'] self.aggregates_client.add_host(aggregate_id, host=host_name) self.addCleanup(test_utils.call_and_ignore_notfound_exc, self.aggregates_client.remove_host, aggregate_id, host=host_name) return host_name @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-aggregates:show") @decorators.idempotent_id('8fb0b749-b120-4727-b3fb-bcfa3fa6f55b') def test_show_aggregate_rbac(self): aggregate_id = self._create_aggregate() rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.aggregates_client.show_aggregate(aggregate_id) @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-aggregates:update") @decorators.idempotent_id('c94e0d69-99b6-477e-b301-2cd0e9d0ad81') def test_update_aggregate_rbac(self): aggregate_id = self._create_aggregate() rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) new_name = data_utils.rand_name('aggregate') self.aggregates_client.update_aggregate(aggregate_id, name=new_name) @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-aggregates:delete") @decorators.idempotent_id('5a50c5a6-0f12-4405-a1ce-2288ae895ea6') def test_delete_aggregate_rbac(self): aggregate_id = self._create_aggregate() rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.aggregates_client.delete_aggregate(aggregate_id) @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-aggregates:add_host") @decorators.idempotent_id('97e6e9df-5291-4faa-8147-755b2d1f1ce2') def test_add_host_to_aggregate_rbac(self): aggregate_id = self._create_aggregate() host_name = self.hosts_client.list_hosts()['hosts'][0]['host_name'] rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self._add_host_to_aggregate(aggregate_id) @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-aggregates:remove_host") @decorators.idempotent_id('5b035a25-75d2-4d72-b4d6-0f0337335628') def test_remove_host_from_aggregate_rbac(self): aggregate_id = self._create_aggregate() host_name = self._add_host_to_aggregate(aggregate_id) rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.aggregates_client.remove_host(aggregate_id, host=host_name) @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-aggregates:set_metadata") @decorators.idempotent_id('ed6f3849-065c-4ae9-a81e-6ad7ed0d3d9d') def test_set_metadata_on_aggregate_rbac(self): aggregate_id = self._create_aggregate() rand_key = data_utils.rand_name('key') rand_val = data_utils.rand_name('val') rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.aggregates_client.set_metadata( aggregate_id, metadata={rand_key: rand_val}) @rbac_rule_validation.action( service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:os-aggregates:create") @decorators.idempotent_id('83c2d727-3b70-4b58-8867-3bc7c2651c1d') def test_aggregate_create(self): rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self._create_aggregate()

commit_message:
Remove ORM relationship between ports and networks

This relationship doesn't serve a purpose and it results
in SQLAlchemy trying to set the network_id column on ports
to NULL when attempting to delete a network with ports in it.

This results in the following exception:

IntegrityError: (1048, u"Column 'network_id' cannot be null")

This exception is not treated as a DBReferenceError by olso.db
which makes detecting races between ports being created on a
network being deleted very noisy in the logs since oslo.db treats
this as a generic DBError.

By removing the relationship, deleting a network will now just
result in a boring standard foreign key constraint failure which
will propagate from oslo.db as a DBReferenceError that is easy
to catch.

The patch that depends on this one adjusts the delete network logic
to capture these ReferenceErrors.

Change-Id: I4166a9bbaded57a77576400929a150123b8f1b2e

commit_message:
Remove text about OSC as a plugin requirement

python-openstackclient should not be in a plugin's requirements.txt
as it will pull in the OSC dependencies that may not be desirable.

Change-Id: Id72745704ec70cab438e766dbac21a838fccb523
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/73/436073/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

This is specifically not a good idea for plugins that are also libraries installed with OpenStack services.

subject: Make the DB URIs host-independent for all services
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-09 10:22:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/40becb93d3767f08ee13211d09582f3bad61f44d', 'message': "Make the DB URIs host-independent for all services

When fixing LP#1643487 we added ?bind_address to all DB URIs.
Since this clashes with Cellsv2 due to the URIs becoming host
dependent, we need a new approach to pass bind_address to pymysql
that leaves the DB URIs host-independent.

In change Iff8bd2d9ee85f7bb1445aa2e1b3cfbff1f397b18 we first create a
/etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf file with a [tripleo] section with the correct
bind-address option.

In this change we make sure that the DB URIs will point to the added
file and to the specific section containing the necessary bind-address
option.

Note that in case the /etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf file does not exist
(because it is created via the haproxy profile), things keep on working
as usual and the bind-address option simply won't be set, which is
totally okay on hosts where there are no VIPs.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ieac33efe38f32e949fd89545eb1cd8e0fe114a12
Closes-Bug: #1663181
Depends-On: Iff8bd2d9ee85f7bb1445aa2e1b3cfbff1f397b18

When fixing LP#1643487 we added ?bind_address to all DB URIs.
Since this clashes with Cellsv2 due to the URIs becoming host
dependent, we need a new approach to pass bind_address to pymysql
that leaves the DB URIs host-independent.

In change Iff8bd2d9ee85f7bb1445aa2e1b3cfbff1f397b18 we first create a
/etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf file with a [tripleo] section with the correct
bind-address option.

In this change we make sure that the DB URIs will point to the added
file and to the specific section containing the necessary bind-address
option.

Note that in case the /etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf file does not exist
(because it is created via the haproxy profile), things keep on working
as usual and the bind-address option simply won't be set, which is

Change-Id: Ieac33efe38f32e949fd89545eb1cd8e0fe114a12

Depends-On: Iff8bd2d9ee85f7bb1445aa2e1b3cfbff1f397b18
"}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2017-02-15 19:23:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/commit/200c8b52d3276c0729494b4c76017f7c769d1f00', 'message': "Make the DB URIs host-independent for all services

When fixing LP#1643487 we added ?bind_address to all DB URIs.
Since this clashes with Cellsv2 due to the URIs becoming host
dependent, we need a new approach to pass bind_address to pymysql
that leaves the DB URIs host-independent.

In change Iff8bd2d9ee85f7bb1445aa2e1b3cfbff1f397b18 we first create a
/etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf file with a [tripleo] section with the correct
bind-address option.

In this change we make sure that the DB URIs will point to the added
file and to the specific section containing the necessary bind-address
option. We do introduce a new MySQLClient profile which will hold all
this more client-specific configuration so that this change can fit
better in the composable roles work. Also, in the future it might
contain the necessary configuration for SSL for example.

commit_message:
Make the DB URIs host-independent for all services

When fixing LP#1643487 we added ?bind_address to all DB URIs.
Since this clashes with Cellsv2 due to the URIs becoming host
dependent, we need a new approach to pass bind_address to pymysql
that leaves the DB URIs host-independent.

In change Iff8bd2d9ee85f7bb1445aa2e1b3cfbff1f397b18 we first create a
/etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf file with a [tripleo] section with the correct
bind-address option.

In this change we make sure that the DB URIs will point to the added
file and to the specific section containing the necessary bind-address
option. We do introduce a new MySQLClient profile which will hold all
this more client-specific configuration so that this change can fit
better in the composable roles work. Also, in the future it might
contain the necessary configuration for SSL for example.

Note that in case the /etc/my.cnf.d/tripleo.cnf file does not exist
(because it is created via the mysqlclient profile), things keep on
working as usual and the bind-address option simply won't be set, which
has no impact on hosts where there are no VIPs.

Co-Authored-By: Damien Ciabrini <dciabrin@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ieac33efe38f32e949fd89545eb1cd8e0fe114a12
Related-Bug: #1643487
Closes-Bug: #1663181
Closes-Bug: #1664524
Depends-On: Iff8bd2d9ee85f7bb1445aa2e1b3cfbff1f397b18

commit_message:
Fix for few failing network rbac tests

Following network rbac api tests are failing -
    1. test_create_network_provider_physical_network
    2. test_update_network_router_external

This patch provides fix for -
    1. test_update_network_router_external

This patch removes test "test_create_network_provider_physical_network"
because it is failing.
As soon as we get a new approach for handling such "hardcoding required"
tests, a new patch can be submitted.

Partial-Bug: #1665105

Change-Id: Iff84ccfed7346fed077c449298b21cd5057f957e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/56/434956/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: net_id=None, if net_id: net_id = net_id else: net_id = self.admin_network['id'] # NOTE(raiesmh08): Patrole can be used for RBAC testing of any # openstack deployment. # Deployments can vary in terms of physical interface defined. # Deployments can have existing physical interface with different # name. So here we can't pass a hardcoded value as # "provider_physical_network". # Following is sample piece (commented) of which can be used for # testing. But in this case here we have used a hardcoded value # "ph-eth0". # So one need to remove this hardcoded value according to their # deployment # rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) # self._create_network(provider_network_type='flat', # provider_physical_network='ph-eth0') # For the time we are skipping this. pass network = self._create_network() self._update_network(net_id=network['id'], router_external=True)
deleted_lines: net_id = self.admin_network['id'] rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self._create_network(provider_network_type='flat', provider_physical_network='ph-eth0') updated_network = self._update_network(router_external=True) self.assertEqual(updated_network['router:external'], True) # Revert back to False updated_network = self._update_network(router_external=False) self.assertEqual(updated_network['router:external'], False)

commit_message:
Use install-pip macro in most source images

1. Enable customization of pip packages in source
branch of most images
2. All pip packages install uniformly through
install-pip macro, user can easily customize his
own pip command (For example using a mirror)

Co-Authored-By: Mauricio Lima <mauriciolimab@gmail.com>
Change-Id: If09582039f690fa4136e8f33200d5da15e092da7

commit_message:
Compute API attach volumes test.
Add tests for attach_volumes

Change-Id: Ie50a534f1684930bd481483ef94f81b56d9cd1d5
Co-Authored-By: Samantha Blanco <sb612u@att.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/patrole refs/changes/24/435624/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2017 AT&T Corp # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from tempest import config from tempest import test from tempest.common import waiters from patrole_tempest_plugin import rbac_rule_validation from patrole_tempest_plugin.rbac_utils import rbac_utils from patrole_tempest_plugin.tests.api.compute import rbac_base CONF = config.CONF class RBACAttachVolumeTestJSON(rbac_base.BaseV2ComputeRbacTest): def _detach(self, server_id, volume_id): if self.attachment: self.servers_client.detach_volume(server_id, volume_id) waiters.wait_for_volume_status( self.volumes_client, volume_id, 'available') def _create_and_attach(self): self.server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE') self.addCleanup(self.delete_server, self.server['id']) # Create a volume and wait for it to become ready self.volume = self.create_volume() waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, self.volume['id'], 'available') # Attach the volume to the server self.attachment = self.servers_client.attach_volume( self.server['id'], volumeId=self.volume['id'])['volumeAttachment'] waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, self.volume['id'], 'in-use') @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:" "os-volumes-attachments:index") @test.idempotent_id('58766dab-b943-47ee-8709-4972c6ac415e') def test_list_volume_attachments_rbac(self): self._create_and_attach() self.addCleanup(self._detach, self.server['id'], self.volume['id']) rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) body = self.servers_client.list_volume_attachments( self.server['id'])['volumeAttachments'] self.assertEqual(1, len(body)) self.assertIn(self.attachment, body) @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:" "os-volumes-attachments:show") @test.idempotent_id('d373ee95-02e7-4eaa-9ab4-bdb11062c477') def test_show_volume_attachments_rbac(self): self._create_and_attach() self.addCleanup(self._detach, self.server['id'], self.volume['id']) rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self.servers_client.show_volume_attachment( self.server['id'], self.attachment['id'])['volumeAttachment'] @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:" "os-volumes-attachments:create") @test.idempotent_id('72924d69-ddce-4cca-b04b-0f3fdce344d3') def test_create_and_attach_volume_rbac(self): self.server = self.create_test_server(wait_until='ACTIVE') self.addCleanup(self.delete_server, self.server['id']) # Create a volume and wait for it to become ready self.volume = self.create_volume() waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, self.volume['id'], 'available') rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) # Attach the volume to the server self.attachment = self.servers_client.attach_volume( self.server['id'], volumeId=self.volume['id'])['volumeAttachment'] waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, self.volume['id'], 'in-use') self.addCleanup(self._detach, self.server['id'], self.volume['id']) @rbac_rule_validation.action(service="nova", rule="os_compute_api:" "os-volumes-attachments:delete") @test.idempotent_id('24a1ba56-f14c-4d80-a0e4-ad11050c44d3') def test_detach_delete_volume_rbac(self): self._create_and_attach() rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=True) self._detach(self.server['id'], self.volume['id']) self.attachment = None rbac_utils.switch_role(self, switchToRbacRole=False) if self.attachment is not None: self.addCleanup(self._detach, self.server['id'], self.volume['id'])

commit_message:
Replace "ara generate" by "ara generate html"

The newest version of ARA, 0.11, deprecated "ara generate" in favor
of "ara generate html". "ara generate" will be removed sometime in
the future so let's adjust it right away.

Change-Id: I31bff0a7e130c329da44b46506f5b12fa8d6deb8
Closes-Bug: #1665746

commit_message:
Disable infracloud-chocolate for zuulv3 dev 2/2

We'll be using chocolate for nodepool+zuulv3 dev during ptg.

We don't want to just set max-servers to 0 because nodepool will
still attempt to manage and clean up servers and get in the way
of our v3 deployment.

Change-Id: If090190b541922ece7e67fa9107e521c050fa484

commit_message:
Multiple dashboard fixes and refactoring

* added recipe neutron-lbaas-dashboard to install the dashboard plugin
  according to the current docs
* removed server.rb recipe and server_type attribute since the only
  available option is apache2
* adapted specs and README accordingly

Change-Id: I4f407598acccd2d21d4204b936122963ebd4f7c8

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-19 11:20:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla/commit/a61ea29e82269f5961290203ac198a1b4c2f0343', 'message': 'Increase haproxy timeouts for mysql connections

commit_message:
Increase haproxy timeouts for mysql connections

Haproxy often breaks mysql connections that results in
"MySQL server has gone away" or similar because of 1 minute
timeouts. Instead the timeouts should be not less than mysql
connections timeouts - in most cases set to 3600s by default
by OpenStack projects

Change-Id: I017e960993da0e650515452f71eaa18931c537a8
Closes-Bug: 1645098
Signed-off-by: Magnus Lööf <magnus.loof@basalt.se>

commit_message:
Re-enable passing horizon::neutron_options via hiera

The hardcoded neutron_options parameter removed the ability to provide
neutron_options via the horizon::neutron_options parameter to the horizon
class. This patch re-enables this funcitonality.

Change-Id: I314d588a50c22594e6dcdfad7fac95d5f4992ab1

commit_message:
Fix ovs-cleanup issue at cleanup scripts

NOTE This is manually ported from kolla-ansible

Move ovs-cleanup step to cleanup-containers,
otherwise bridges will not be removed because neutron_openvswitch_agent
container does not exists after running cleanup-containers.

Add logic to cleanup ovs bridges only when neutron_openvswitch_agent
is removed, so when removing other container from a parameter at script
invocation ovs-cleanup will not be executed.

Closes-Bug: 1640178
Change-Id: I32aeabbbee821d8879acdccef3c72ca65b80bb88
Signed-off-by: Magnus Lööf <magnus.loof@basalt.se>

commit_message:
Consider also newton for bulk introspection

This commit adds also newton release to be checked for the bulk
introspection.
Without this you won't be able to deploy because of this error:

Requested API version 1.6 is not supported by the server or the
requested operation is not supported by the requested version.
Supported version range is 1.1 to 1.22

Things get worse because this error does not block the execution of
quickstart, because the related command is executed in $() so it does
not obey to the set -eux on the top of the script, making the process
going forward and failing the overcloud deployment with the "No valid
host found" infamous error.

Change-Id: I5740b908bac421356bbd7b6f3fa8104f21b5cf25

commit_message:
Revert "Don't disable Nagle algorithm in HttpProtocol"

We depend on eventlet 0.19.0 or newer at least, the workaround
is not needed anymore

This reverts commit 21d139d441f9e43b35b2b96d05e962dff9a690a1.

Change-Id: Ib5a8ca113e5a25109b4829db4915e550db86f6e9

added_lines: from zunclient import exceptions as exc class UpdateContainer(command.Command): """Updates one or more container attributes""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".UpdateContainer") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(UpdateContainer, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'container', metavar='<container>', help='The number of virtual cpus.') parser.add_argument( '--cpu', metavar='<cpu>', help='The number of virtual cpus.') parser.add_argument( '-m', '--memory', metavar='<memory>', help='The container memory size in MiB') return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): client = _get_client(self, parsed_args) container = parsed_args.container opts = {} if parsed_args.memory is not None: opts['memory'] = parsed_args.memory if parsed_args.cpu is not None: opts['cpu'] = parsed_args.cpu if not opts: raise exc.CommandError("You must update at least one property") try: client.containers.update(container, **opts) print(_('Request to update container %s has been accepted') % container) except Exception as e: print("update for container %(container)s failed: %(e)s" % {'container': container, 'e': e})
